description: Borrowed from Latin ēvānēscēns, present participle of ēvānēscō (“I vanish, I fade away, I lapse”).

entries.meaning: The act or state of vanishing away; disappearance.
examples: We suffer equal pain from the pertinacious adhesion of unwelcome images, as from the evanescence of those which are pleasing and useful;

entries.meaning: The event of fading and gradually vanishing from sight.
examples: the evanescence of the morning mist.
